newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Moroccan bourse keeps its upward trend.
newsitem.headline: Moroccan bourse keeps its upward trend.

text.p: The Casablanca stock exchange closed on Thursday 0.06 percent higher compared with the previous session, a bourse official said.
The all-share index closed at 434.81 points from 434.57 points on Wednesday.
"The market's largest capitalisations such as ONA Group and BMCE bank were behind the bourse index's slight rise," said one stockbroker.
ONA Group, Morocco's largest private group, gained two dirhams in one session, to close at 497 dirhams.
Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur, a market blue chip, was traded at 398 dirhams, up from 396 dirhams on the previous session.
Societe Nationale d'Investissment, the country's second largest private conglomerate, rose three dirhams to close at 530 dirhams.
The conglomerate has a market capitalisation of more than 5.5 billion dirhams.
Traded official volume on the bourse was 26 million dirhams against 19 million dirhams on Wednesday.
